Package org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers

Class ADHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers.DirectoryHelper
      • org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers.ADAMHelper
        • org.forgerock.openam.idrepo.ldap.helpers.ADHelper
  • public class ADHelper
extends ADAMHelper
    Handles AD specific aspects of Data Store, more specifically handles the fact that AD uses bitmasks to store account related informations in the userAccountControl attribute.
    Author:
    Peter Major

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive​(String value,
                        String inactiveValue)
        Based on the incoming userAccountControl value tells whether the user account is active or disabled.
        Overrides:
        isActive in class DirectoryHelper
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the userAccountControl attribute.
        inactiveValue - Not used in this context.
        Returns:
        true if the second bit is not set.

      • getStatus

        public String getStatus​(DJLDAPv3Repo idRepo,
                        String name,
                        boolean isActive,
                        String userStatusAttr,
                        String activeValue,
                        String inactiveValue)
                 throws IdRepoException
        Based on the incoming values returns the value for the userAccountControl.
        Overrides:
        getStatus in class DirectoryHelper
        Parameters:
        idRepo - The IdRepo implementation to be used for querying the current value of userAccountControl.
        name - The name of the identity.
        isActive - Whether the status needs to be set to active or inactive.
        userStatusAttr - The name of the user status attribute (should be always userAccountControl).
        activeValue - Not used in this context.
        inactiveValue - Not used in this context.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the userAccountControl with the account disable flag.
        Throws:
        IdRepoException - If there was an error while trying to retrieve the current userAccountControl value.
